description: US National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan insisted the Biden administration will enter into a defense pact with Saudi Arabia only if the kingdom normalizes relations with Israel, the Financial Times reported.
title: Sullivan Says US-Saudi Defense Pact Not Possible Without Israel Deal, FT Reports

description: French President Emmanuel Macron is calling for an update of the country’s economic ties with China, just as the country’s leader Xi Jinping is expected to travel to France for a State visit.
title: France’s Macron Calls for Reset of Economic Ties With China

description: Labour wins in the UK’s two biggest cities completed a string of local election successes by opposition leader Keir Starmer that showed his party firmly on course for victory at a general election later this year.
title: Labour Mayor Wins Cap Triumphant Election Run for Keir Starmer

description: South Africa’s President Cyril Ramaphosa says he’s confident that his government has found the balance between spending on services while reining in the nation’s ballooning debt levels.
title: South Africa’s Ramaphosa Confident Government Can Stabilize Debt

description: Togo’s ruling party opened up a commanding lead as the vote count from this week’s parliamentary vote passed the half-way mark, setting the stage for the family dynasty of President Faure Gnassingbé to extend its 57-year rule of the West African nation.
title: Togo’s Initial Vote Count Shows Family Dynasty on Track to Extend 57-Year Rule

description: Donald Trump’s campaign sought to stir enthusiasm among prospective donors to his White House bid, contending that the ex-president has a chance to go on offense and expand the electoral map.
title: Trump Campaign Talks Up Prospects of Flipping Two States to GOP

description: US taxes are likely to rise as lawmakers look to narrow the federal deficit, Warren Buffett said, as Washington prepares for major tax negotiations next year.
title: Buffett Says US Corporate Taxes Likely to Rise to Tame Deficit

description: Civilian facilities in the Ukrainian cities of Kharkiv and Odesa came under Russian missile fire on Saturday afternoon, according to local officials.
title: Russian Missiles Target Civilian Facilities in Odesa, Kharkiv

description: An Iranian warship has embarked on a mission in oceanic waters, Iran’s state media reported, in the wake of a warning by Houthi rebels that they could renew their attacks on vessels transiting the region.
title: Iranian Warship on the Move Amid Houthi Threat to Attack Ships

description: Labour saw swings in its favor in the first results announced in London’s mayoral race, as the UK’s main opposition party expressed confidence that incumbent Sadiq Khan would win a historic third term.
title: Labour Sees Gains in First Results in London Mayor’s Race

description: A Hamas delegation has reportedly arrived in Cairo for new talks aimed at reaching a cease-fire in Gaza, where the war between the Iran-backed militant group and Israel is nearing the seven-month mark.
title: Gaza Truce Talks Set to Restart in Egypt With Hopes for Deal

description: Capital gains taxes are the price of making a good investment. They’re levied on profitable stock trades and real estate deals and can also apply to sales of businesses, pieces of art, collectible cars, gold or other assets. President Joe Biden has long vied to increase the capital gains rate, a goal that’s not likely to be realized before the November elections but will be a key topic of debate next year when former President Donald Trump’s tax cuts expire and Congress faces a major fight that
title: How Capital Gains Are Taxed and How That Might Change

description: The UK government is finalizing a share-sale proposal that will cut its stake in NatWest Group Plc to as low as 10%, according to Sky News.
title: UK Nears Finalizing Plan for NatWest Share Sale, Sky Reports

description: The founder of the seized Rolf auto dealership has vowed to fight for compensation as nationalizations are on the rise in Russia.
title: Putin Critic Warns Kremlin Will Seize More Assets to Punish Foes

description: Chad’s military ruler Mahamat Deby is almost certain to win the country’s May 6 presidential election, cementing the ruling junta’s power in a move that could jeopardize the future of US military engagement in the region.
title: Oil Rich Chad’s Junta Leader Set to Win Vote as US Ties Fray

description: A dispute between the UK and Ireland over a surge in asylum-seekers is threatening to upend their already fragile relationship. With elections on the horizon for the leaders of both countries, neither side appears likely to back down.
title: UK, Ireland Leaders on Collision Course Over Migration Surge
